Letter to Louis L. McInnis from S. Seaton, August 13, 1886
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 23 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: Letter from S. G. Seaton to Louis L. McInnis, a teacher, regarding his son's education and anticipated visit to the area during vacation. Seaton expresses concerns about the duration of his son's studies, the adequacy of his practical education, and the reliability of monthly school reports, advocating for honest rather than inflated assessments. He also inquires about deposit requirements and mentions personal hardship and potential relocation to California due to his wife's health.

[Header] Fort Worth Aug 13 . 80

Friend Mc

In my absence to Cal
a line was recd from you
and that you would likely
visit our Section during vacation
if you do it is time you were
putting in appearance ,
You hope Wade (Johnson) Seaton
will return &c . Yes sir thats our
intention . I asked him
if he thought he could finish in
3yrs rather 2 more years . he thought
not , I told him then I feared that
he not deeply enough interested
or may be teachers too easy
I am leaing my boy wholly
with you teacher , & I want
him to have a good practical
education .
With best wishes for you & yours I
remain

[Signature] T. Seaton

[Margin: over]

P S

Do they require a deposit of $5.00
for any possible damage this term ?
as did last. I'll want to know
just what to send by him.
I been very hard run for year & my
trip to California made me still weaker.
if wifes health dont improve I may have

The monthly reports of my son reach
